definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
an expert always produces the best work (idiom)

sentences.english: I am Mallika, the banker, a friend of the good Pandu here.
sentences.chinese: 我是银行家摩利卡，是潘杜在这儿的一位朋友。

sentences.english: He was a mighty good man and a mighty good banker!
sentences.chinese: 他是一个大好人，一个很好的银行家。

sentences.english: We send in our investment bankers.
sentences.chinese: 我们再送我们的投资银行家去那里。

sentences.english: He is both an expert, and master in antique authentication.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位鉴定古玩的行家里手。

sentences.english: Did someone tell you that the balloonist has arrived?
sentences.chinese: 有人告诉你那个热气球飞行家已经来了吗？

sentences.english: Bankers, financiers and fund managers are among the biggest losers.
sentences.chinese: 银行家，金融家，和基金经理是最大的暑假。

sentences.english: A banker can hardly afford a scandal, my dear.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，银行家也不会向不名誉的人提供信贷。

sentences.english: The banker gave a start of surprise .
sentences.chinese: 银行家惊讶得打了一个寒噤。

sentences.english: No banker is bigger than his client.
sentences.chinese: 没有哪个银行家比客户大牌。

sentences.english: As all bankers know, league tables can mislead.
sentences.chinese: 所有的银行家都知道，排行榜有误导作用。

sentences.english: St. Matthew is the patron saint of bankers.
sentences.chinese: 圣人马修被视为是银行家的保护神。

sentences.english: Bankers have described the supertax as confirmation of the UK's hostility to finance.
sentences.chinese: 银行家形容，附加税证实了英国对金融业的敌意。

sentences.english: Steve had been meeting with the bankers in separate groups .
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫分头去和一批批的银行家会晤。

sentences.english: The huge brick house which Banker White had built on Buckey Street had overshadowed it.
sentences.chinese: 银行家怀特在白克埃街上建的大砖屋，使它黯然失色。

sentences.english: The banker absconded with embezzled funds.
sentences.chinese: 那个银行家涉嫌盗用资金。

sentences.english: B: Make sure you hire the experts to do it.
sentences.chinese: 那你得找几个行家来刷。

definition: experienced person/an old hand at sth
eyesight/strength of vision/the ability to make discerning judgments
a much-travelled person, well acquainted with the ways of the world
to be adept at sth/to be an expert in a trade or profession
slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
